trans-unit.source: List Affinity Groups
trans-unit.target: List Affinity Groups

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Affinity Groups</languageKeyword> operation lists the affinity groups that are associated with the specified subscription.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Affinity Groups</languageKeyword> operation lists the affinity groups that are associated with the specified subscription.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>List Affinity Groups</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>List Affinity Groups</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with the subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: GET
trans-unit.target: GET

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: The format of the response body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format of the response body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the response body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the response body.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Specifies the name of the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the name of the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Specifies the base-64-encoded identifier of the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the base-64-encoded identifier of the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Specified the description of this affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Specified the description of this affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Specifies the data center in which the affinity group is located.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the data center in which the affinity group is located.

trans-unit.source: Capability
trans-unit.target: Capability

trans-unit.source: Specifies the capabilities that of the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the capabilities that of the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: The capabilities of an affinity group are typically derived from its location.
trans-unit.target: The capabilities of an affinity group are typically derived from its location.

trans-unit.source: An affinity group may show a reduced set of capabilities if the specific set of resources assigned to support the affinity group do not support a capability, for example high-memory Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: An affinity group may show a reduced set of capabilities if the specific set of resources assigned to support the affinity group do not support a capability, for example high-memory Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>PersistentVMRole</languageKeyword> capability enables an affinity group to support Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>PersistentVMRole</languageKeyword> capability enables an affinity group to support Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>HighMemory</languageKeyword> capability enables the affinity group to support Virtual Machines that use high memory relative to the number of CPUs.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>HighMemory</languageKeyword> capability enables the affinity group to support Virtual Machines that use high memory relative to the number of CPUs.

trans-unit.source: For more information about Virtual Machines sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>
trans-unit.target: For more information about Virtual Machines sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>

trans-unit.source: CreatedTime
trans-unit.target: CreatedTime

trans-unit.source: Specifies in UTC format when the affinity group was created.
trans-unit.target: Specifies in UTC format when the affinity group was created.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>CreatedTime</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-01-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>CreatedTime</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-01-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: ComputeCapabilities
trans-unit.target: ComputeCapabilities

trans-unit.source: Specifies the roles sizes that are available for deployments in the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the roles sizes that are available for deployments in the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Deployments of web roles and worker roles may have different sizes available than deployments of Virtual Machines.
trans-unit.target: Deployments of web roles and worker roles may have different sizes available than deployments of Virtual Machines.

trans-unit.source: For more information about role sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Windows Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about role sizes, see <externalLink><linkText>Virtual Machine and Cloud Service Sizes for Windows Azure</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/dn197896.aspx</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>ComputeCapabilities</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>ComputeCapabilities</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-05-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: ComputeCapabilities
trans-unit.target: ComputeCapabilities

trans-unit.source: Specifies the roles sizes that are available for deployments in the affinity group.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the roles sizes that are available for deployments in the affinity group.

trans-unit.source: Element name
trans-unit.target: Element name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: VirtualMachineRoleSizes
trans-unit.target: VirtualMachineRoleSizes

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of RoleSize elements.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of RoleSize elements.

trans-unit.source: WebWorkerRoleSizes
trans-unit.target: WebWorkerRoleSizes

trans-unit.source: Contains a collection of RoleSize elements.
trans-unit.target: Contains a collection of RoleSize elements.

trans-unit.source: RoleSize
trans-unit.target: RoleSize

trans-unit.source: Specifies the role size that is available for the type of deployment.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the role size that is available for the type of deployment.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: You can also use the following resources to manage affinity groups:
trans-unit.target: You can also use the following resources to manage affinity groups:

trans-unit.source: Create, configure, or delete an affinity group
trans-unit.target: Create, configure, or delete an affinity group

trans-unit.target: Create an Affinity Group in the Management Portal
